t: Isaiah 32
A King Will Reign in Righteousness
Behold,*pn a king will reign in righteousness, and*ld princes will rule in justice.
Each*ln will be like a hiding place from the wind, a*ld shelter from the storm, like*ln streams of water in a dry place, like*ld the shade of a great rock in a weary land.
Then*ln the eyes of those who see will not be closed, and*ld the ears of those who hear will give attention.
The*ln heart of the hasty will understand and know, and*ld the tongue of the stammerers will hasten to speak distinctly.
The*ln fool will no more be called noble, nor*ld the scoundrel said to be honorable.

For*ln the fool speaks folly, and*ld his heart is busy with iniquity, to*ln practice ungodliness, to*ld utter error concerning the Lord,*s to*ln leave the craving of the hungry unsatisfied, and*ld to deprive the thirsty of drink.
As*ln for the scoundrelâ€” his devices are evil; he*ld plans wicked schemes to*ln ruin the poor with lying words, even*ld when the plea of the needy is right.
But*ln he who is noble plans noble things, and*ld on noble things he stands.
Complacent Women Warned of Disaster
Rise*pn up, you women who are at ease, hear my voice; you*ld complacent daughters, give ear to my speech.
In*ln little more than a year you*ld will shudder, you complacent women; for*ln the grape harvest fails, the*ld fruit harvest will not come.
Tremble,*ln you women who are at ease, shudder,*ld you complacent ones; strip,*ln and make yourselves bare, and*ld tie sackcloth around your waist.
Beat*ln your breasts for the pleasant fields, for*ld the fruitful vine,
for*ln the soil of my people growing*ld up in thorns and briers, yes,*ln for all the joyous houses in*ld the exultant city.
For*ln the palace is forsaken, the*ld populous city deserted; the*ln hill and the watchtower will*ld become dens forever, a*ln joy of wild donkeys, a*ld pasture of flocks;
until*ln the Spirit is poured upon us from on high, and*ld the wilderness becomes a fruitful field, and*ld the fruitful field is deemed a forest.
Then*ln justice will dwell in the wilderness, and*ld righteousness abide in the fruitful field.
And*ln the effect of righteousness will be peace, and*ld the result of righteousness, quietness and trust forever.
My*ln people will abide in a peaceful habitation, in*ld secure dwellings, and in quiet resting places.
And*ln it will hail when the forest falls down, and*ld the city will be utterly laid low.
Happy*ln are you who sow beside all waters, who*ld let the feet of the ox and the donkey range free.
